BiomeDef.label: Salt desert
BiomeDef.description: A very dry area with almost no life as there are salt fields here. Deserts can be warm or quite cold

BiomeDef.label: desert oasis
BiomeDef.description: A large amount of water surrounded by a very dry area. The oasis itself has rich soil and lots of animals, but is surrounded by extreme desert.

BiomeDef.label: savanna
BiomeDef.description: A savanna is a rolling grassland scattered with shrubs and isolated trees, which can be found between a tropical rainforest and desert biome. Not enough rain falls on a savanna to support forests.

BiomeDef.label: wasteland
BiomeDef.description: Lifeless desert. Once, life here was erased by a natural disaster, leaving only scorched fields and stone cliffs. Very few plant and animal species have been able to adapt to this change.

BiomeDef.label: grassland
BiomeDef.description: Grasslands, as the name suggests, are areas where the vegetation is dominated by grasses and shrubs. The soil is fertile, but there is little protection from the elements.

BiomeDef.label: steppes
BiomeDef.description: Steppes are high-altitude grassland regions. A steppe may be semi-desert or covered with grass or shrubs or both, depending on the season and latitude.

BiomeDef.label: permafrost
BiomeDef.description: Permafrost exists on the border between tundra and ice sheets. The ground is permanently frozen, and much of it is covered in ice, but the ice is at most a few meters, rather than kilometers, thick. There is little vegetation beyond scrub brush, and few animals.

BiomeDef.label: temperate desert
BiomeDef.description: Temperate deserts are cooler but often even drier than subtropical deserts. Vegetation is sparse, and the ground is typically more rocky than sandy.

BiomeDef.label: Sea reefs
BiomeDef.description: This area is partially covered with water and has a special biological nature.

BiomeDef.label: red forest
BiomeDef.description: A clear radioactive imprint remained in this place forever. Few managed to survive, but in this quest, some creatures took on bizarre and even terrible forms.

BiomeDef.label: volcanic fields
BiomeDef.description: Warm forest areas near geothermal springs and volcanoes. The area is rich in sulfur and geysers.

BiomeDef.label: Ice peaks
BiomeDef.description: Discharged air and absolute cold are constant companions of these mountains. Few animals have been able to adapt to such a life. Ice storms and strong winds permeate all life.
